itemDescription: Scottish army officer and coin collector

wikipedia_page.main: George Robert Ainslie (1776–1839) was a Scottish general of the British Army, with a short lived and controversial career in the Caribbean, a Lt. Gov. of Cape Breton, and noted for his coin collecting pursuits.

link_mentions.page: List of lieutenant governors of Nova Scotia

response: **# George Robert Ainslie, Lieutenant Governor of Cape Breton Island (1816–1820)

link_mentions.page: List of colonial governors and administrators of Grenada

response: A number of bald eagles nest around the lake. The lake was named after George Robert Ainslie, the Lieutenant Governor of Cape Breton Island from 1816 to 1820, when Cape Breton became part of Nova Scotia.
